channel.title: linear-algebra on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in linear-algebra on Notes

item.title: From Jacobi iteration to Krylov subspace method
item.description: Usually Krylov subspace methods are presented as separate category of iterative procedure from classic iterative methods based on splitting the system matrix.

item.title: QR factorization and Arnold iteration
item.description: Both are used to generate an orthogonal basis, but do you know the difference? We often see them as separate chapters in the book, however we can gain a lot of understanding by looking them side-by-side.

item.title: Numerical analysis notes
item.description: Fixed point methods Definition From an approximation attempt based on the split of the matrix. General implementation Relation between fixed-point iteration and preconditioning.

item.title: Linear algebra notes
item.description: Linear algebra examples and visualizations to reinforce the theory. Matrices and linear mapping Invertible matrix interpretation A matrix is invertible, means that it can maps a vector into another uniquely.
